definitions.definition: a priest of the lowest rank, especially in the Church of England, whose job is to help the vicar (= priest of a particular area)
to be in charge of selecting and caring for objects to be shown in a museum or to form part of a collection of art, an exhibition, etc.:
examples: She curated a recent exhibition of Indian artwork.

definitions.definition: to be in charge of selecting films, performers, events, etc. to be included in a festival:
examples: a Messiaen festival curated by pianist Pierre-Laurent Aimard

definitions.definition: to select things such as documents, music, products, or internet content to be included as part of a list or collection, or on a website:
examples: a curated library of short movies available online
